page.title: 11VANDALISM PAISLEY
page.content: In some part of our area vandalism is a big problem.Youths smash telephone boxes,windows and spray graffiti over walls and pavements. {Jenny's Well Road}is a popular haunt for these people. The police have caught several youths spraying graffiti there and they have been fined.There is an old abandoned railway line which used to carry trains from Glasgow to Gourock which is now popular among glue-sniffers. They spray the area around the line with graffiti.A tunnel under which the railway used to run is covered with graffiti. Other derelict buildings have been given the same treatment for example the old mill which was closed because asbestos was found in the building.The youths probably do these things because they have nothing to occupy their spare time.
